titleStmt.title: Album Ducler 2: Divinités et souverains de l'Inde

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: 1st, 4th and 5th series of gouache paintings commissioned by Ducler.

collation.desc: the front cover. BnF shelfmark sticker on verso.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. Blank except for BnF old shelfmark on f[1]r.

182 folios = gouache paintings. Library Arabic foliation 1-182 in black ink. Parallel original (?) Arabic foliation 1a-108a (lf1-108), 1c-28c (lf139-136), 1d-46d (lf137-182) in black pencil. Verso blank.
1 folio = back guard leaf. No foliation. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

layoutDesc.layout: Black frame divided in two boxes: the upper, larger, box for the gouache painting, the lower, smaller box for bilingual labels (Tamil in Tamil script and French in Latin script).

decoNote.desc: Royal cypher N, of Napoléon III.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker (front cover, verso): INDIEN 744
BIBLIOTH. IMPERIALE, that is, Bibliothèque Impériale.
Name of binder and date of binding: J. WEBER 1865.
BnF old shelfmark in black ink (f[1]r): Ind. 99.
Stamp (red ink) (in the labels box of every recto folio of U1): B.R (below a crown, both in an oval), that is, Bibliothèque Royale.

binding.p: Library binding. With name of the library, title, royal cypher, binder's name and date of binding on the spine.

origin.origDate: See 1831 in the lower right corner of the labels box of every recto folio of U1.

provenance.p: Gouache paintings commissioned by Philippe Étienne Ducler (1778-1840), colonial administrator in Karikal (Karaikkāl). See Burnouf (1832, p. 85).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Ducler (BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 95 (1ère série, 4e série, 5e série).

listBibl.bibl: Burnouf, Eugène (1832). “Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique.” Journal asiatique 10, p. 84-87. — Report by E. Burnouf & J. B. Eyriès.
Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 109.

body.p:
piṟumā-viṣṇu-civaṉ Ivarkaḷ y--ore caṭalam-āyē kōpittu y-irukkun tiṟittuvam.
Inta teyvattukku nālu kai-y. Ireṇṭil cakkaramum Uṭukkaiyum irukkutu. maiyaṟṟa
reṇṭum Apaiyam-ākavum vāram-ākavum irukkutu.

karaikkāl kuvaṟnmāl pōṭṭiḷōr pakkircāyupu y-eṉpaṟ-u
ṭaiya peṇcāti-y-ākiya pāṭacāpīpi
Batesabibi, femme de Paquirsaheb Concièrge du Gouvernement de Karikal.
